channel.title: Website?
channel.description: What is a good website hoster for a runescape private server?

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @Kjloveday Kjloveday
item.description:
@Kjloveday wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:548317”][quote author=Kjloveday link=topic=667222.msg4462138#msg4462138 date=1418074342]
As in good i mean not to pricey but not to expensive maybe $20 a month?
[/quote]
x10premium is like $7.95/month unless you buy bulk time (like a year’s worth of hosting)[/quote]

Thanks sorry for late reply.

Read full topic

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

I used x10premium for years and years with no issues at all, anything that I did have to submit a ticket for it was answered within an hour, very professional hosting company.

Read full topic

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

sk8rdude461:

You have to be careful though, because I actually believe that offer is when you sign up for a years worth of hosting (So you’re paying for all 12 months of hosting in bulk).

This is true, and generally the case!

Kjloveday be sure to pay attention during the check-out process as many hosting providers will try and sneak in extra “offers”, be it e-mail accounts or “website building” features etc these are all useless and aim to squeeze more money out of you. As posted by sk8rdude461, you may need to sign up for a years worth of hosting to be allowed the free domain/ssl cert/dedicated ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

stCky:

$20 is getting expensive - you’d expect 24/7 support and 99% up time with plenty of space and bandwidth, I wouldn’t spend that much until your website is popular enough. As suggested, http://x10premium.com/ look good, on their home page their plan starts at $6.95 per month and gets cheaper, comes with a free domain per year as well as SSL cert. I’d go for that.

You have to be careful though, because I actually believe that offer is when you sign up for a years worth of hosting (So you’re paying for all 12 months of hosting in bulk).

Read full topic

Been a member of nexhost for the past month. It’s a decent reseller.

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’d say x10premium (Yes, premium, not their free service) is a good start.
They offer basically “unlimited” everything (I’m sure terms apply.).
They’ve integrated Cloudflare (You can enable it in your cPanel).
I haven’t had an issue with any site on their server.
Their support is amazing - Esp for premium.
They also sell VPS’s in case you need to scale up from “reseller hosting” to something better.

Read full topic

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“stCky, post:2, topic:548317”]Define “good”, does that mean cheap? or does it mean stable and high quality? Does that mean free? Does it mean an abundance of space and bandwidth?

These are the questions you want to ask. “Good” can and will mean different things to different people.

An actual question to answer for me would be, what is your monthly budget? Set a budget and browse the top google results for a package that meets your criteria.[/quote]
What is cheap but stable & high quality with decent disk space and bandwidth = good

Read full topic

item.title: Website?
item.dc:creator: @stCky stCky
item.description:
@stCky wrote:

Define “good”, does that mean cheap? or does it mean stable and high quality? Does that mean free? Does it mean an abundance of space and bandwidth?

These are the questions you want to ask. “Good” can and will mean different things to different people.

An actual question to answer for me would be, what is your monthly budget? Set a budget and browse the top google results for a package that meets your criteria.

Read full topic
